      • switchRearFrontCamera

        public boolean switchRearFrontCamera()
        Description copied from interface: IMXCall
        Switch between device cameras. The transmitted stream is modified according to the new camera in use. If the camera used in the video call is the front one, calling switchRearFrontCamera(), will make the rear one to be used, and vice versa. If only one camera is available, nothing is done.
        Specified by:
        switchRearFrontCamera in interface IMXCall
        Overrides:
        switchRearFrontCamera in class MXCall
        Returns:
        true if the switch succeed, false otherwise.

      • muteVideoRecording

        public void muteVideoRecording(boolean muteValue)
        Description copied from interface: IMXCall
        Mute/Unmute the recording of the local video attendee. Set isVideoMuted to true to enable the recording of the video, if set to false no recording is performed.
        Specified by:
        muteVideoRecording in interface IMXCall
        Overrides:
        muteVideoRecording in class MXCall
        Parameters:
        muteValue - true to mute the video recording, false to unmute

      • isCameraSwitched

        public boolean isCameraSwitched()
        Description copied from interface: IMXCall
        Indicate if a camera switch was performed or not. For some reason switching the camera from front to rear and vice versa, could not be performed (ie. only one camera is available).


        See IMXCall.switchRearFrontCamera().

        Specified by:
        isCameraSwitched in interface IMXCall
        Overrides:
        isCameraSwitched in class MXCall
        Returns:
        true if camera was switched, false otherwise

      • launchIncomingCall

        public void launchIncomingCall(VideoLayoutConfiguration aLocalVideoPosition)
        The call has been detected as an incoming one. The application launches the dedicated activity and expects to launch the incoming call. The local video attendee is displayed in the screen according to the values given in aLocalVideoPosition.
        Specified by:
        launchIncomingCall in interface IMXCall
        Overrides:
        launchIncomingCall in class MXCall
        Parameters:

      • onAnsweredElsewhere

        public void onAnsweredElsewhere()
        The call has been answered on another device. We distinguish the case where an account is active on multiple devices and a video call is launched on the account. In this case the callee who did not answer must display a "answered elsewhere" message.
        Specified by:
        onAnsweredElsewhere in interface IMXCall
        Overrides:
        onAnsweredElsewhere in class MXCall
